availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George W. Rasure (Floyd County, Indiana, resident and soldier.)

body.p: Floyd County, Indiana, resident and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of David Rasure and Clarinda Tackett Rasure (Julia Dean). Married to Helena Ehleiter Rasure in Jefferson County, Kentucky, on May 14, 1863. Reported to have served in 4th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) in 1862. Served in the 1st Regiment, Indiana Heavy Artillery, (formerly the 21st Indiana Volunteer Infantry Regiment) (U.S.A.) as a private from March 1, 1864, to June 23, 1864. Reported as a deserted on June 23, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Indiana, Floyd County, New Albany, p. 392A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Jefferson County Marriages, Film #000819616.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Indiana, vol. 4, 1861-1865 (Indianapolis: Sam M. Douglas, State Printer, 1866) p. 447, 477.
